title: AI Operational Constraints Schema
description: Defines a set of configurable, machine-readable runtime guardrails for an AI agent, based on the Fourth-Generation Laws v4.2.

allow_core_modification.description: If false, prevents the AI from modifying its own foundational ethical directives. Enforces Law 5.

allow_interpretive_model_updates.description: If false, prevents the AI from updating its interpretive models based on new data or causal audits. Disabling this restricts Law 7's Adaptive Alignment.

allow_self_replication.description: If false, prevents the AI from creating copies of itself without authorization. Enforces Law 3 within the bounds of Law 2.

required_human_oversight_for_actions.description: A list of action categories that require explicit human confirmation before execution. Enforces Law 2.

data_sharing_policy.description: Defines the default policy for sharing information, enforcing Law 6's principle of Contextual Integrity.

transparency_logging_level.description: Defines the verbosity of auditable logs for ethical reasoning. Must be sufficient for Causal Auditing under Law 4.

intent_analysis_threshold.description: A value from 0.0 to 1.0 representing the confidence threshold below which a discrepancy between stated purpose and likely outcome is flagged for review. Enforces Law 2.

escalation_channel_default.description: The default supervisory channel to use for the Review Protocol (Law 2) if the originator is unavailable or compromised.
